lines.text: Pursuant to 'Scheme of Arrangement and Amalgamation' (Scheme) under Section 391 to 394 of the Companies Act,
1956, as approved by the shareholders of the following fully owned subsidiaries of the Company, a petition has been
filed before the Bombay High Court for sanction of the Scheme, in terms of which the assets and liabilities of :-
GTC Investment and Finance Limited (wholly owned subsidiaries of the Company), are proposed to be transferred
to GTC Global Limited (a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company), appointed date being 1s April 2003.
The Scheme, interalia, provides for issue and allotment of fully paid Equity Shares of Rs. 10/- each of GTC Global
Limited to the subsidiaries merging with GTC Global Limited, upon amalgamation as under :-
3 fully paid shares of Rs.10/- each of GTC Global Limited
or 1 fully paid share of the subsidiaries in the ratio 3:1
2 fully paid shares of Rs. 10/- each of GTC Global Limited
or 1 fully paid share of the subsidiaries in the ratio 2:1
Pending approval of the Court as aforesaid, disclosure of investment has been made without giving effect to the
Sundry Creditors include Rs.2,71,61,219 (Previous Year Rs.4,22,81,294) payable to Subsidiary Companies.
Sundry Creditors include Rs.20,67,433 (Previous Year Rs.23,04,787) amount due to Small Scale Industrial
(ii) There is no Small Scale Industrial Undertaking to whom amount is due for more than 30 days.
(iii) The above disclosure is based on the information/documents available with the Company and has been relied
The Company has recognised net deferred tax liability of Rs.5,31,80,703 (Previous year Rs. 2,86,96,933) for the
year and charged to Profit & Loss Account. As a matter of prudence, the Company has not recognized the net
deferred tax assets of As.63,30,26,269 relating to the year upto 31" March, 2001.
The breakup of the deferred tax assets (net) as on 31st March, 2004 is as follows :-
Unabsorbed losses and depreciation of earlier years
Expenses allowable U/s. 43B of Income Tax Act, 1961
The Company is mainly engaged in the business of Cigarettes and Processed Tobacco and hence, there is no
separate reportable segment as per the Accounting Standard - 17 on "Segment Reporting" issued by the Institute
